confession.seduction_context: Was on way to sell salt at Damelievre and Blainville when she met big man dressed in black who offered her money, then persuaded her to renounce God

testimony.quarrel_subject: money she held for Margueritte's daughter

timeline.subject: Margueritte Forget
timeline.details: Confrontation with Ydatte veuve Demenge le Moyne, who declared she had seen her at sabbat; accused denied this, but was sent to prison

timeline.subject: Margueritte Forget
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; accused denied claims about sabbat

timeline.subject: Margueritte Forget
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - given thumbscrews, possibly racked; confessed

timeline.subject: Margueritte Forget
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

timeline.subject: Margueritte Forget
timeline.details: Confirmed earlier confessions and named accomplices

timeline.subject: Margueritte Forget
timeline.details: Formal death sentence from court at Rozieres

accomplices_named.name: Unknown (already executed)
accomplices_named.context: Named during interrogation on 31 January 1604 as one of two from Blainville at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Unknown (former midwife)
accomplices_named.context: Named as second person from Blainville at sabbat; had previously been midwife

accomplices_named.name: Unknown (resident of la petite rue)
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice; lived in middle house of 'la petite rue'

prior_accusations.context: Accused her of being at sabbat on 18 December 1603
Accused her of being at sabbat on same day as Ydatte Vaultrin

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Forget
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle l'auroit soit au champ ou a la ville
notable_quotes.english: that she would have her either in the field or in the town
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Catherine femme Jean George during salt selling dispute

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Forget
notable_quotes.french: Viensa par le nom Dieu putain je t'auray, por ce que tu ne me veux donner l'argent que tu a de ma fille
notable_quotes.english: Come here by God's name whore I will have you, because you don't want to give me the money you have of my daughter
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Alizon femme Michiel le Geay during quarrel over money

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Forget
notable_quotes.french: Nicolas tu n'y viendra plus guieres
notable_quotes.english: Nicolas you will not come here much longer
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Nicolas Gontiere at Haussonville market

notable_quotes.english: pour putain pour avoir servy les pretres
notable_quotes.context: During confrontations, said she held Catherine femme Jean George for a whore for having served the priests

relationships.evidence_text: Margueritte veuve Claudon Forget; widow since his death 10 or 11 years earlier
Father was maitre Charles hacquebutier of the late cardinal
mother Jennon (whom she had never seen)
her son Charles, who was fetching four oxen in service of marchand bouchier de son altesse
money she held for her daughter
she and her late husband Nicolas Gontiere
story of death of her father Nicolas Gontiere
Damoiselle Anne Magnien, femme Abraham Clignotte tailleur aux salines de Rozieres
Catherine femme Jean George de Rozieres
Annon femme Mengin Regnaude le jeune
Alizon femme Michiel le Geay de Rozieres
Mengeotte femme Villermin Grillat de Rozieres
Catherine femme Demenge Chevallier de Rozieres
quarrel over some money she held for her daughter
angry at having to repurchase clothes of her son-in-law, who wanted to go to the war

economic_context.details: Margueritte was a salt seller who had been fined three times in the last year by 'les chevalcheur de saline' for selling salt in villages. Multiple quarrels arose from competition with other salt sellers (Catherine femme Jean George, Alizon and her sister, Nicolas Gontiere and his wife at Haussonville). Also had dispute over money owed for daughter. Economic vulnerability evident - had few goods, was itinerant seller.

harms_catalog.method_alleged: physical beating (though couldn't be seen because of fog)

harms_catalog.victim_name: daughter of Catherine femme Jean George
harms_catalog.method_alleged: physical beating (though couldn't be seen because of fog)

harms_catalog.victim_name: Annon femme Mengin Regnaude le jeune
harms_catalog.harm_description: struck in stomach while 4 months pregnant, went into labour same evening (premature labor)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Annon talking to Laurence Viart about how Annon's husband had reproached Margueritte

harms_catalog.harm_description: struck great blow in left eye, eyelid torn, required surgeon for 6 weeks
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Margueritte Forget (accused said it was her daughter)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: money she held for Margueritte's daughter

harms_catalog.victim_name: Alizon femme Michiel le Geay and her sister
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: they were calling Margueritte a witch

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, lost use of limbs, had to be fed like child for 2 years until death
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: competition over salt selling at Haussonville
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: on next visit - as soon as he arrived home

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed dogs which made it difficult for her to sell salt

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to pay what they owed for salt
refused to pay what they owed for salt

harms_catalog.harm_description: made hail on three occasions (none affected Rozieres); admitted fourth which had affected Rozieres

material_culture.context: Primary commodity sold by accused and several witnesses - source of economic competition and quarrels
Money held by Alizon for Margueritte's daughter - source of quarrel
Clothes of son-in-law that Margueritte had to repurchase when he wanted to go to war - precipitated her anger and seduction
Given by devil to kill women and animals
Given by devil to kill women and animals
Used by Charles (son) to attack Alizon and her sister
Worn by some people at sabbat
Worn by some people at sabbat
Charles was fetching them in service of marchand bouchier de son altesse

Place where Margueritte had to leave due to witch reputation

Where Margueritte was going to sell salt when she met the devil
Where Margueritte was going to sell salt when seduced; also location of two named accomplices
Location of one named accomplice (in middle house of la petite rue)

spatial_references.place_name: execution site (a musket shot outside town)
spatial_references.context: Where Mengeotte met Margueritte who seemed lost
Pilgrimage site mentioned by Margueritte for healing of Anne Magnien's father
Street in Roumain where accomplice lived in middle house
Salt works where Abraham Clignotte worked as tailleur; Anne Magnien's father was controlleur

historical_context.military_details: Son-in-law wanted to go to war - Margueritte had to repurchase his clothes, which angered her and preceded her seduction by devil
weather_events: hail - made on multiple occasions at sabbat, including one that affected Rozieres
economic_hardship_indicators: She had been fined three times in last year for illegal salt selling in villages
Multiple disputes over money and competition for salt trade
Debt disputes over payment for salt
religious_calendar_references: Friday mentioned as day of attack on Alizon

prior_legal_disputes.description: Alizon femme Michiel le Geay complained to the bailli about sword attack by Charles
Fined three times in last year by 'les chevalcheur de saline' for selling salt in villages

hearsay_chains.content: During his fatal illness 14 years earlier, accused had said pilgrimage to St Claude should be made
During illness he always claimed Margueritte was responsible
Same as sister - father claimed Margueritte was responsible

emotional_state_notes: Said she saw she must die as result of false accusations
Proclaimed innocence of witchcraft during confrontations

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Held Catherine femme Jean George 'pour putain pour avoir servy les pretres' (for whore for having served the priests)

Said Alizon femme Michiel le Geay was 'putain' (whore); claimed it was her daughter who struck Alizon in the eye, not herself; said her son attacked Alizon and sister with stick because they were always calling her witch
Said those accusing her of being at sabbat were 'aveuglez du diable' (blinded by the devil)

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with detailed witness testimony, confession under torture, and death sentence. Trial shows pattern of economic competition in salt trade leading to accusations. Margueritte was itinerant salt seller who had witch reputation in multiple towns. Confessed under torture to devil pact, sabbat attendance, making hail, and killing animals. Named three accomplices in other villages.
